New Records: Jared Jones set a new career high for innings in a professional season with 128⅓ innings this year
Key Match Events: Jared Jones yielded six earned runs across five innings
Elly De La Cruz got a slider that caught too much of the plate and yanked it down the right-field line for a no-doubt, three-run homer
Billy Cook’s solo home run — the second of his MLB career — in the top of the ninth
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Derek Shelton said the quality of Jones’ offerings remains solid but not at all times
Shelton emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Jones said of his performance, “Terrible,” Jones said of his performance. “Everything was terrible today.”
Shelton said, “Early in the year, he was really consistent with all of his weapons, and I think what we've seen is a little bit of inconsistency”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pirates secured their 6th straight losing season with the loss to the Reds
David Bednar responded from a challenging last outing against the Cardinals in which he gave up three runs (two earned) across ⅓ of an inning
The Pirates labored at the plate, with Rhett Lowder having his way across five scoreless innings
Others: The Pirates will face the Reds again on Sunday, with Paul Skenes (10-3, 2.07) on the mound for the Pirates and Hunter Greene (9-4, 2.83) for the Reds
